answerText: George Herbert[10] George Herbert was one of these poets, who were characterized by their ability to use conceits to compare two unlikely situations. John Donne was another example.
heading: Terrapin |2013 | Editors 1 - FINAL | 7 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The speaker of one of his poems describes how "there was wine before my sighs did dry it" in a poem that compares our "petty thoughts" to "ropes of sand." For 10 points each: [10] Identify this author of poems such as "Church Monuments" and "The Collar," which are found in The Temple.
